title: Furniture Delivery and Recycling Collection Service
content: A furniture retailer operates multiple regional warehouses (`<loc_depot>`) to serve customers requesting deliveries of new furniture (`<demand_linehaul>`) and pickups of old furniture for recycling (`<demand_backhaul>`). Each truck departing a depot has a capacity limit of `<capacity>` cubic meters. Routes must ensure that deliveries (linehaul) are prioritized before pickups (backhaul) to prevent overloading. The goal is to minimize total travel distance while efficiently clustering customer stops near each depot, allowing trucks to end their routes at the final customer location.

title: Grocery Home Delivery with Food Waste Pickup
content: A grocery chain uses distributed distribution centers (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver perishable goods (`<demand_linehaul>`) to households and collect organic waste (`<demand_backhaul>`) for composting. Each vehicle must carry a mixed load without exceeding `<capacity>` kilograms. Deliveries must precede pickups to avoid contamination, and routes must originate from the nearest depot while ending at the last stop. The aim is to optimize fuel efficiency and waste collection coverage across urban and suburban areas.

title: Tech Equipment Deployment and E-Waste Retrieval
content: A technology firm deploys multiple regional hubs (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver new electronics (`<demand_linehaul>`) to corporate clients and retrieve outdated devices (`<demand_backhaul>`) for recycling. title: Construction Material Distribution and Return Logistics
content: A construction supplier manages several depot locations (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver building materials (`<demand_linehaul>`) to job sites and collect unused or defective supplies (`<demand_backhaul>`). content: A fashion retailer uses multiple regional warehouses (`<loc_depot>`) to replenish store inventory (`<demand_linehaul>`) and collect returned garments (`<demand_backhaul>`) from pop-up shops and customer drop-off points. title: Agricultural Inputs Delivery & Empty Container Collection
content: A farming cooperative operates from several regional depots `<loc_depot>` to service scattered farms `<loc_customer>`. Using depots in different cities (`<loc_depot>`), trucks with `<capacity>` kg capacity must deliver infrastructure to festival locations (`<loc_customer>`) while simultaneously collecting dismantled materials from concluded events. Each truck starts at a depot, services a mix of deployment and retrieval stops, and ends its route at the final customer site. The challenge is to balance delivery and pickup demands (`<demand_linehaul>` and `<demand_backhaul>`) without overloading vehicles, while minimizing total travel distance.

title: Aviation Ground Support Equipment Delivery & Maintenance Retrieval
content: An aviation logistics firm operates from regional depots (`<loc_depot>`) to supply ground equipment (e.g., refueling trucks, baggage carts) to airports (`<loc_customer>`). Simultaneously, damaged or outdated equipment must be retrieved for repair or disposal. Vehicles (`<capacity>` ton capacity) must first deliver operational gear (linehaul) and then collect faulty items (backhaul) during the same route. Routes are open-ended, ending at the last airport visited. The goal is to optimize routes across multiple depots while ensuring no truck exceeds its capacity during mixed delivery/pickup cycles.

title: Hazardous Material Disposal & Safety Equipment Delivery
content: A chemical plant network uses multi-depot (`<loc_depot>`) logistics to distribute safety gear (e.g., respirators, protective suits) to industrial sites (`<loc_customer>`) while collecting hazardous waste for regulated disposal. Each truck (`<capacity>` cubic meter capacity) must handle both tasks in a single route. Deliveries and pickups (`<demand_linehaul>` and `<demand_backhaul>`) must be sequenced to avoid overloading, with routes terminating at the final disposal site. The solution must prioritize safety compliance and minimize inter-depot travel costs.

title: Seasonal Equipment Redistribution & Off-Season Retrieval
content: A regional equipment rental company operates from seasonal depots (`<loc_depot>`) to distribute winter gear (e.g., snow blowers) and summer tools (e.g., irrigation systems) to customers (`<loc_customer>`). Vehicles (`<capacity>` ton capacity) start at depots, deliver seasonal items (linehaul), and then pick up off-season equipment (backhaul) along the same route. Open routes end at the last customer stop, ensuring efficient use of vehicle space and reduced mileage between depots.

title: Public Infrastructure Maintenance & Scrap Collection

title: Coastal Marine Equipment Maintenance & Salvage Logistics
content: Maritime service providers operate from multiple harbors (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver repair kits, fuel, and spare parts (`<demand_linehaul>`) to offshore vessels and coastal facilities (`<loc_customer>`). Each boat has a `<capacity>` limit, requiring careful load balancing between outbound deliveries and inbound pickups. Routes start at depots but end at the final service location to maximize operational efficiency without return trips.

content: A city’s public transport authority uses `<loc_depot>` depots to service bus depots and train stations (`<loc_customer>`).
